titleInfo.title: Captain John Chisholm and S. Williams in Knoxville to William Blount

subject.topic: Frontier migration/experiments in representative democracy, encounters with Native Americans .
Anti-democracy impulses: Slavery, free people of color, and Removal of Native Americans .

mods.note: Chisholm`s letter lists the articles necessary to outfit the Choctaw Indians for their visit to the President of the United States. Williams letter mentions his acting as a guide to five Choctaw Indians and their interpreter betwween Nashville and Knoxville. Three horses were lost or stolen on the way.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
